intro: Mappia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mappia, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and produces small, white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. The fruit is a small, three-lobed capsule that contains several seeds.
